entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 2:40PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER FROM 1PM EST TO 7PM EST TUESDAY... A dry cold front will cross the region Tuesday morning with winds shifting to the northwest and becoming gusty through Tuesday afternoon. Northwest winds around 10 to 15 mph with gusts around 20 mph combining with critical minimum RH values around 20 to 25 percent will lead to increased fire danger in the afternoon.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued March 06 at 10:00AM HST until March 10 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE SUMMITS OF THE BIG ISLAND AND HALEAKALA... .A broad upper level trough will move over the state and will bring a prolonged period of very strong winds for the summits of the Big Island and the summit of Haleakala this week. Winds could stay very strong through the weekend.
